metadata.title: CVE-2019-5108 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in the Linux kernelprior to mainline 5.3. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability bytriggering AP to send IAPP location updates for stations before therequired authentication process has completed. This could lead to differentdenial-of-service scenarios, either by causing CAM table attacks, or byleading to traffic flapping if faking already existing clients in othernearby APs of the same wireless infrastructure. An attacker can forgeAuthentication and Association Request packets to trigger thisvulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5108` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-6.7.0-2001-raspi-realtime - 6.7.0-2001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-realtime - 6.8.0-1008.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
